item.title: 华尔街上半年股灾为全天候投资组合带来回报
item.description: 尽管关税、财政边缘政策、通胀担忧和地缘政治冲突充满戏剧性，但 2025 年上半年可能会因为另一件事而被多元化投资者铭记：这是多年来市场同步涨势最强劲的一段时期。【原文：Somehow, for all its drama — tariffs, fiscal brinkmanship, inflation fears, and geopolitical flare-ups — the first half of 2025 may be remembered by diversified investors for something else entirely: the strongest stretch of synchronized market gains in years.】

item.title: 美联储戴利称下次降息更可能在秋季进行
item.description: 旧金山联邦储备银行行长玛丽-戴利（Mary Daly）表示，今年秋季降息看起来比决策者在 7 月份开会时降息更合适。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco President Mary Daly said an interest-rate cut this fall looks more appropriate than moving when policymakers gather in July.】

item.title: 比特币网络活动放缓，价格却在高位附近徘徊
item.description: 机构投资者终于加入比特币行列，一直以来都是比特币爱好者们预测天价的振奋人心的呼声。【原文：Once institutional investors are finally onboard has long been a rallying cry for Bitcoin enthusiasts projecting sky-high price forecasts.】

item.title: 可避免的美国：为什么特朗普的政策会让美国旅游业损失数十亿美元？
item.description:
今天的 "Big Take "播客：特朗普总统的 "美国优先 "政策如何将国际游客拒之门外，预计将使美国旅游业损失数十亿美元。【原文：

On today’s Big Take podcast: How President Trump’s “American First” policies have kept international tourists away, forecasted to cost the US travel industry billions.

item.title: 美联储博物馆报告多宗房地产交易
item.description: 周五公布的一组新的美联储地区银行行长财务披露信息显示，圣路易斯联储主席阿尔贝托-穆萨莱姆及其配偶去年出售和购买了几处住宅房地产。【原文：A new set of financial disclosures for Federal Reserve regional bank heads released Friday show that St. Louis Fed President Alberto Musalem and his spouse sold and purchased several residential real estate holdings last year.】

item.title: AQR 的克利夫-阿斯内斯在批评迈克尔-赛勒的策略时站在吉姆-查诺斯一边
item.description: AQR 资本管理公司的克利夫-阿斯内斯（Cliff Asness）表示，他同意著名做空者吉姆-查诺斯（Jim Chanos）对《战略》创始人迈克尔-赛勒（Michael Saylor）的批评，即使用可转换债务为杠杆比特币代理提供下跌保护，同时继续积累加密货币。【原文：AQR Capital Management’s Cliff Asness says he’s in agreement with famed short seller Jim Chanos when it comes to his criticism of Strategy founder Michael Saylor’s claim that the use of convertible debt affords the leveraged Bitcoin proxy downside protection while continuing to accumulate the cryptocurrency.】

item.title: 克利夫-阿斯内斯称零售业推动私有资产是个 "可怕 "的想法

item.title: LinkedIn 首席执行官提出建议，帮助人工智能为你的职业生涯保驾护航
item.description: LinkedIn 首席执行官就人工智能如何改变人们（包括他自己）的工作方式发表了自己的看法。但首先...【原文：LinkedIn’s CEO offers his thoughts on how AI is changing the way people work, himself included. But first…】

item.title: 在 Uber 和 Lyft 反击后，纽约市为司机设定了较小的加薪幅度
item.description: 纽约市周五宣布了新的共享出行司机最低工资规定，在优步（Uber Technologies Inc.【原文：New York City on Friday announced new minimum-pay rules for rideshare drivers, settling on a smaller-than-proposed 5% increase following pushback from Uber Technologies Inc. and Lyft Inc.】

item.title: LME 实施新规迫使交易商减少大宗金属押注
item.description: 伦敦金属交易所周五制定了一项新规则，迫使交易商减少大额头寸，而在这之前的几个月里，世界上一些最大的能源交易商的到来对市场造成了冲击。【原文：The London Metal Exchange set a new rule on Friday to force traders to reduce large positions, after the market was rocked in recent months by the arrival of some of the world’s largest energy traders.】

item.title: 彼得罗寻求投票允许修改哥伦比亚宪法
item.description: 哥伦比亚总统古斯塔沃-彼得罗（Gustavo Petro）表示，他将寻求就是否成立一个修改宪法的议会进行表决。【原文：Colombian President Gustavo Petro said he’ll seek a vote on whether to create an assembly to change the constitution.】

item.title: 普京称主要产油国无需紧急援助石油市场
item.description: 俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京表示，由于以色列和伊朗之间的紧张局势对油价的影响有限，全球石油市场迄今尚未要求生产国采取任何额外措施。【原文：The global oil market so far does not call for any additional steps from producers amid the conflict between Israel and Iran as the tensions have had only a limited effect on prices, according to Russia’s President Vladimir Putin.】

item.title: 八方环球聘请前摩根士丹利主管推进私人信贷业务
item.description: 据知情人士透露，摩根士丹利私人信贷业务直接借贷业务主管肖恩-沙利文（Sean Sullivan）已经离职。【原文：Morgan Stanley’s head of direct lending origination for its private credit business, Sean Sullivan, has left the firm, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 阿波罗就 EDF 英国核电厂达成 45 亿英镑债券交易
item.description: 阿波罗全球管理公司同意帮助法国电力公司（Electricite de France SA）通过私人债券配售筹集多达 45 亿英镑（61 亿美元）的资金，用于欣克利角 C 核电站的建设和在英国的其他投资。【原文：Apollo Global Management Inc. agreed to help Electricite de France SA raise as much as £4.5 billion ($6.1 billion) in private bond placements to fund the construction of the Hinkley Point C nuclear power plant and other investments in the UK.】

item.title: 据说 CareerBuilder 和 Monster 风险投资公司考虑破产
item.description: 据熟悉情况的人士透露，CareerBuilder 和 Monster 这两家早期在线求职先驱的合资企业正在与顾问合作，准备申请破产。【原文：A joint venture involving CareerBuilder and Monster, the early pioneers of online job hunting, is working with advisers on a potential bankruptcy filing, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 象牙海岸预计到 2035 年石油产量将增长五倍以上
item.description: 受近期发现的石油和两个海上油田开始生产的推动，象牙海岸预计未来十年的石油产量将增长五倍以上。【原文：Ivory Coast expects its oil output to increase more than fivefold in the next decade, boosted by recent discoveries and the start of production at two offshore fields.】

item.title: 在投资规模人工智能之前，Meta 讨论了购买 "惑 "的问题
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Meta Platforms 公司与人工智能搜索初创公司 Perplexity AI 公司就可能的收购进行了讨论，之后便开始对 Scale AI 公司进行数十亿美元的投资。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. held discussions with artificial intelligence search startup Perplexity AI Inc. about a possible takeover before moving ahead with a multibillion-dollar investment in Scale AI, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Aflac 报告网络泄漏事件可能导致个人数据泄露
item.description: Aflac Inc. 说，最近的一次网络安全漏洞可能使入侵者在未经授权的情况下获取客户的个人信息，包括社会安全号以及健康和索赔数据。【原文：Aflac Inc. said a recent cybersecurity breach could have given intruders unauthorized access to customers’ personal information, including Social Security numbers, as well as health and claims data.】

item.title: 被制裁的石油商 2Rivers 表示已停止交易
item.description: 一家因经营俄罗斯石油而在 12 月受到英国制裁的能源贸易公司周五表示，它将在 2024 年底停止贸易业务。【原文：An energy trading house sanctioned in December by the UK for handling Russian oil said Friday it ceased trading operations at the end of 2024.】

item.title: 创业公司 Too Good To Go 筹集 3 亿欧元资金
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Too Good To Go公司正在考虑在新一轮融资中筹集2亿欧元（约合2.31亿美元）至3亿欧元，以支持其业务扩张。【原文：Too Good To Go, which operates an app that allows users to buy near-expired food at a discount, is considering raising €200 million ($231 million) to €300 million in a new funding round to support its business expansion, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 参议院通过稳定币法案后，Circle 首次获得买入评级
item.description: 在美国参议院本周通过立法，为与美元挂钩的加密货币制定监管规则之后，Seaport Global首次给予这家稳定币发行商买入评级，Circle Internet Group Inc.的股价周五最高上涨了17%。【原文：Circle Internet Group Inc.’s shares rose as much as 17% on Friday after Seaport Global gave the stablecoin issuer its first buy rating in the wake of the US Senate’s move this week to pass legislation setting up regulatory rules for cryptocurrencies pegged to the dollar.】

item.title: 亚马逊终止起亚 Soul 的快速送货服务，转而雇佣临时工
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）正在结束让驾驶起亚 Souls 的司机进行当日送货的实验，转而依靠其 "千兆经济 "工人网络。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. is ending an experiment that saw drivers in Kia Souls make same-day deliveries and will rely on its network of gig-economy workers instead.】

item.title: 意大利将为非洲能源和铁路融资提供 2.5 亿欧元
item.description: 意大利机构将向非洲金融公司提供高达 2.5 亿欧元（约合 2.88 亿美元）的资金，以促进欧洲国家参与与关键矿产和可再生能源相关的供应链。【原文：Italian institutions will provide as much as €250 million ($288 million) to Africa Finance Corp. to boost the European nation’s participation in supply chains related to critical minerals and renewable energy.】

item.title: Telegram 如何成为极端分子和犯罪活动的 "磁铁
item.description: 信息服务 Telegram 是全球下载量最大的应用程序之一。它的私密聊天设置使其成为专制政权国家公开讨论的自由空间。但是，Telegram 对内容审核采取的相对宽松的方式，让试图阻止犯罪活动和错误信息传播的政府感到沮丧，而这些活动和信息传播会破坏社会稳定。【原文：Messaging service Telegram is one of the most downloaded apps worldwide. Its private chat setting has made it a free space for open discussion in countries with authoritarian regimes. But a relatively light-touch approach to content moderation on Telegram is frustrating governments trying to stop criminal activities and the spread of misinformation that can destabilize societies.】

item.title: 芯片股因有关中国可能受到新限制的报道而下滑
item.description: 在《华尔街日报》报道特朗普政府正在考虑对中国采取进一步限制措施后，台湾积体电路制造股份有限公司和其他芯片制造商的股价周五下滑。【原文：Shares of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. and other chipmakers slid on Friday after the Wall Street Journal reported that the Trump administration is considering further restrictions on China.】

item.title: 新兴市场摆脱中东风险，美国银行大举避险
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）表示，随着投资者对地缘政治紧张局势升级带来的风险越来越自满，欧洲、中东和非洲地区的货币押注为美元反弹提供了最佳对冲。【原文：Currency bets across Europe, Middle East and Africa offer the best hedges against a rebound in the US dollar as investors grow complacent about risks from escalating geopolitical tensions, Bank of America Corp. says.】

item.title: 特朗普承诺的 "中国磁铁快速流动 "尚未兑现
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布与中国政府达成 "已完成 "的贸易协议已近 10 天，但美国公司对何时能从中国收到至关重要的磁铁，以及华盛顿方面是否会允许恢复大量其他出口产品，仍然一无所知。【原文：Almost 10 days since President Donald Trump declared a “done” trade deal with Beijing, US companies remain largely in the dark on when they’ll receive crucial magnets from China — and whether Washington, in turn, will allow a host of other exports to resume.】

item.title: 美联储称劳动力市场平衡，指出移民速度放缓
item.description: 美联储周五表示，移民数量的急剧下降导致工人供应增长速度放缓，有助于在就业增长降温的情况下保持劳动力市场的平衡。【原文：A sharp stepdown in immigration has led the supply of workers to grow more slowly, helping to keep the labor market in balance as job growth cools, the Federal Reserve said Friday.】
